Body:
AM-ADD-NYT-BUDGET  
(mk) 

   Add N.Y. Times News Service budget for papers of Monday, June
28:

   CULTURE

   (Coded e)

   WEILL-CENTENNIAL (Chemnitz, Germany) _ In this eastern German
industrial city, where celebrations of next year's 100th
anniversary of Kurt Weill's birth began with a flourish this month,
the multitalented German-born composer is being remembered above
all as a Jew, a seemingly peculiar reminder that it was Weill's
very Jewish identity that forced him to flee Germany in the first
place. By Alan Riding.

   TIDE-BOOK-REVIEW _ Ann Finkbeiner reviews `Against the Tide: The
Battle for America's Beaches,' by Cornelia Dean.

   TV-GUNS-REVIEW _ `Investigative Reports: Guns in America' begins
on A&E Monday night, with a look at people for whom the gun is a
recreational tool or a means of defense or a way to make a living.
By Walter Goodman.

   CAMINO-THEATER-REVIEW (Williamstown, Mass.) _ The inaugural
production of the Williamstown Theater Festival's new season finds
bright bounce and energy, not to mention a gutsy sense of humor, in
a thickly poetic allegory of expiring hopes and trampled ideals. By
Ben Brantley.

   FINANCIAL

   (Coded f)

   ECOM-REALPEOPLE (Undated) _ Electronic commerce companies have
spent millions trying to make their sites more ``personal,'' with
technology that allows them to customize their product offerings to
a particular shopper's needs. Now those sites are trying a novel
approach to personalization: real people. By Bob Tedeschi.

   COMPUTER-BRIEFS (Undated) _ News items from the world of
computers. By Laurie J. Flynn.

   QWEST-MARKETPLACE (Undated) _ When the board of Frontier Corp.
meets Monday, as expected, to discuss the unsolicited bid made by
Qwest Communications International Inc., the debate will be far
from elementary. That's because nothing is ever as simple as it
looks. By Laura M. Holson.

   ECON-CALENDAR (Undated) _ Key government figures this week.

   BOND-CALENDAR (Undated) _ The week's planned offerings.

   EQUITIES (Undated) _ Equity issues coming to market this week.

   DIVIDEND-MEETINGS (Undated) _ Major meetings this week.

   BIZGLANCE (Undated) _ Major financial stories at a glance.

   PATENTS (Undated) _ The weekly patents column. By Sabra
Chartrand.

   MEDIA-BUSINESS

   (Coding varies.)

   REMNICK-NEWYORKER-MEDIA (New York) _ The gulf between the glitzy
style and frenetic pace of Tina Brown, the former editor of The New
Yorker, and the more earnest, relaxed mien of David Remnick, the
magazine's new editor, has become the defining hallmark of
Remnick's first year at the magazine. By Alex Kuczynski.

   MEDIA-TALK (Undated) _ News items about MTV, CBS and a
best-selling book. By staff.
